chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D. Porep was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $6,655.93 to William T. Flood

--to pay restitution, due as to Case #16CF26, of $43.98 to Fort Atkinson Pick N' Save

--to pay surcharges due on both this case #15CF380 and #16CF26

The Court indicates that any unpaid restitution at the end of the supervision period may be converted to a civil judgment
--to pay costs and surcharges due on both this case #15CF380 and #16CF26
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--to maintain absolute sobriety: no consumption of alcohol 

--no possession or use of illegal drugss 

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--no contact with Matthew Kutz or with WIlliam T. Flood or Sandra Flood

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling , including a mental health evaluation or vocational evaluation as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--random drug and alcohol testing at the discretion of the Agent

--use of technology-monitoring such as an alcohol monitoring bracelet at the discretion of the Agent

--to write a letter of apolgy to Mr. & Mrs. Flood and to Pick N' Save, or if the victims chose it, to participate in a mediated face to face apology session

--To comply with DNA sample provision

Arresting Agency:  Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
It is Ordered that, under the provisions of Chapter 973 of the WI Statutes, the following actionis hereby taken:

As a condition of probation, the defendant, Andrew Porep, is sentenced to the Jefferson County Jail for period of 9 months, beginning the date the Judge signs this order, with release privileges for treatment. Release privileges for employment shall be gratned for the last 90 days of this term. Absolute sobriety required.
of Court Appearance and Alternative to Revocation Agreement

[Clerk's note to file:]   MK reviews the unedited real-time transcript from the 2/11/16 Plea Hearing and verifies that pleas were taken only on Count #1-Case 15CF380, and on Counts #1, #2, #5-Case #16CF26.  
The Plea Hearing minutes are incorrect when it is indicated that Defendant Andrew D. Porep entered a plea of No Contest on Count #1-16CF18.  Instead, as set forth in the terms of the Criminal Case Settlement form signed by the parties, and as referenced by the Court during the Plea Hearing, Case #16CF18 is read in and dismissed.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #15CF380, #16CF18, #16CF26 called at 3:54pm. 
Defendant Andrew D. Porep in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance; victim restitution forms are submitted. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Porep makes a statement.

On Case #15CF380, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Porep on Probation for four years, with conditions:
--to serve 120 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for work search, work, assessment and and treatment. meeting with his Agent, to commence forthwith. The Court stays 80 days of those 120 days.  This stay can be can be lifted in whole or in part by Court Order 
--Mr. Porep is required to serve this Jail term without alcohol or non-prescribed drugs in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work release privileges
--to undergo AODA evaluation and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling , including a mental health evaluation or vocational evaluation as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or use of illegal drugss 
--random drug and alcohol testing at the discretion of the Agent
--use of technology-monitoring such as an alcohol monitoring bracelet at the discretion of the Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with Matthew Kutz or with WIlliam T. Flood or Sandra Flood
--to write a letter of apolgy to Mr. & Mrs. Flood and to Pick N' Save, or if the victims chose it, to participate in a mediated face to face apology session 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay restitution of $6,655.93 to William T. Flood
--to pay restitution, due as to Case #16CF26, of $43.98 to Fort Atkinson Pick N' Save
--to pay costs and surcharges due on both this case #15CF380 and #16CF26

Days credit for time already served if Probation is revoked: 39 days
The Court indicates that any unpaid restitution at the end of the supervision period may be converted to a civil judgment 

----------------------------

On #16CF26-- Counts #1, #2, #5, the Court sentences Mr. Porep: 
--to serve 40 day on each count with Huber privileges, to commence forthwith concurrent with each other and concurrent with the conditional term in Case #15CF380
--Mr. Porep is required to serve this Jail term without alcohol or non-prescribed drugs in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber release privileges
--Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court and counsel agree that the Court has the authority to order the payment of the restitution in this case as a condition of Probation in Case #15CF380.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given 
recess 4:29pm
[Post-hearing/Off-record the Court indicates to the clerk that it is ordering that the costs and surcharges due in Case #16CF26 be paid as a condition of Probation in Case #15CF380.  Any unpaid balance due on costs and surcharges at the end of the supervision period in Case #15CF380 may be converted to a civil judgment.   MK]
Sentencing hearing at 03-11-2016 03:30 pm
with elements and criminal case settlement

Cases 15CF380, 16CF18 & 16CF26 called together at 10:42 am [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Andrew D. Porep in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Porep waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CF380, Count#1-16CF18 and Counts #1, #2 & #5-16CF26; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts#3, #4 & #6-16CF26
Atty De La Rosa requests matter be set over for sentencing
Bond to remain the same; Court reviews letter submitted by defendant with parties provides to Atty De La Rosa who indicates that he has not seen 
Recess: 11:00 am

Case called at 1:31 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Andrew D. Porep appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Mr. Porep is eligible for SPD Services

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-Not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
Recess: 1:34 pm
